intro: Cyclosorus urdanetensis, commonly known as the Urdanet sedge, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Venezuela. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or streamside habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
